name: USA Football Mix Quiz | USA | 10 Questions

questions.text: The Philadelphia Eagles made it to Super Bowl XXXIX. Unfortunately, they lost the game to which team?
questions.explanation:
New England Patriots.

	The Eagles lost Super Bowl XXXIX, but they put up a good fight against the Patriots.  New England only edged them out by 3 points in a 24-21 win.

questions.text: When did the University of South Florida win their first bowl game?
questions.explanation:
2006.

	They played in their first bowl game in 2005, but lost.  Their first win came in 2006 at the PapaJohns.com Bowl by defeating ECU.

questions.text: It may be known that John Cappeletti won the 1973 Heisman Trophy after toting the ball for Penn State as the nation's finest running back. Another Penn State player was the first in Heisman history to garner the most first place votes, yet fail to win the ultimate prize. What was the name of this Penn State Heisman runner-up?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Fusina.

	Fusina was the Penn State quarterback from midway through the 1976 season through the end of his senior year in 1978. Fusina was the runner-up in his senior year to Oklahoma running back Billy Sims, who would later star for the Detroit Lions. Fusina, though a splendid college quarterback, did not find as much success in the NFL. He did, however, lead the Philadelphia Stars to the first champisonhip of the rival USFL.

questions.text: Kurt Warner took the snaps for which NFL team in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Arizona Cardinals.

	At the start of the season, the Cardinals were choosing between putting Matt Leinart or Kurt Warner as their starting quarterback. They picked Kurt Warner. It was Warner's 13th season in the NFL. He led the Cardinals to an outstanding season and a Super Bowl appearance, but lost.

questions.text: Who was the head coach of the Michigan Wolverines in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Rich Rodriguez.

	He was the former coach at WVU and came to Michigan.  2008 was Rich's first season with the Wolverines, but their 3-9 record was not much of a welcome.

questions.text: Before NFL head coach Andy Reid took over the Philadelphia Eagles, he was a quarterback coach and an assistant coach for which team?
questions.explanation:
Green Bay Packers.

	When he was the quarterback coach, he worked with the NFL legend Brett Favre. He was also the assistant to then head coach of the Packers, Mike Holmgren.

questions.text: Which 2008 New York Jet player was a QB at Missouri?
questions.explanation:
Brad Smith.

	Brad Smith came to the Jets in 2006, and was transformed from QB to WR.  He was also a kick returner for the Jets.

questions.text: Which 2008 Philadelphia Eagle wore the number 36?
questions.explanation:
Brian Westbrook.

	Westbrook rushed for 936 yards and 9 TDs in 2008.  He was in his seventh season with the Eagles.

questions.text: Joe Paterno led Penn State to more than 30 bowl games in his career.  During that time, Penn State has visited one bowl more than any other. To what bowl did Penn State make their first of a record six?
questions.explanation:
Fiesta Bowl.

	Penn State defeated Arizona State in the 1977 Fiesta Bowl in their first of six trips to Tempe with Paterno. Interestingly, Penn State has never lost a Fiesta Bowl with Paterno at the helm. They defeated Ohio State after the 1980 season, Southern Cal in 1981, Tennessee in 1991, and Texas in 1996. The most famous Penn State Fiesta Bowl win was the 14-7 victory over number one Miami (Fla) that capped the 1986 season (and the 100th year of Penn State football), with Penn State's second National Championship.

questions.text: Who won the NFL Coach of the Year Award in 2008?
questions.explanation:
Mike Smith.

	Mike Smith of the Atlanta Falcons beat Sparano of the Miami Dolphins by one vote.
